__e: Harvey, that is great and nobody wants that more than I do, but it's just one meeting.
Harvey, it's late. I've had a long clay. So, if you don't mind...
The truth is, Harvey, you don't need to come to me anymore.
- That's everything I promised I'd get Harvey, and it took me less than a day.
Right. But you're not Harvey, and I'm not you.
It's always about Harvey, and it's clear to everyone here that whatever he does is fine with you.
Harvey, she told me she didn't steal those things. I believed her the same way you did.
Harvey told me that I should give you his office, and I came in here prepared to do just that.
And when I say "get to you," you got to remember what I did to make Harvey put me away in the first place.
You know as well as I do Harvey is not interested in anything I've got to say at the moment.
Harvey had nothing to do with this.
I want to know why the FBI blew away our own Lee Harvey Oswald.
What I want from you is that you look me straight in the eye and assure me you had nothing at all to do with that day in Dallas, and that you did not know Lee Harvey Oswald or Jack Ruby.
Lee Harvey Oswald, my son, even after his death, has done more for his country than any other living human being.
Harvey, the reason he called me and not you is because he knew you wouldn't take no for an answer.
Harvey needs Donna more than I do.
Which Harvey already said no to.
